questions.q: Which of the following is NOT a type of cable used as a physical transmission medium?
questions.explanation: Wireless is a transmission medium but is not categorized as a cable [1].

questions.q: What does UTP stand for in networking?
questions.explanation: UTP stands for Unshielded Twisted Pair [1].

questions.q: What is the primary advantage of using fiber optic cables over copper cables?
questions.explanation: Fiber optic cables provide significantly higher bandwidth and speed than copper alternatives [1].

questions.q: Which of the following cables is typically used for Ethernet connections?
questions.explanation: Twisted pair is the standard cable type used for Ethernet connections [2].

questions.q: What type of cable is characterized by having a central conductor surrounded by insulation and a metallic shield?
questions.explanation: This describes the physical structure of a Coaxial cable [2].

questions.q: Which of the following is a characteristic of STP cables?
questions.explanation: Shielded Twisted Pair (STP) uses a metallic shield to reduce electromagnetic interference [2].
options: They have shielding to reduce interference.
They are only used for short distances.
They are made of glass fibers.

questions.q: What is the purpose of a crossover cable?
questions.explanation: Crossover cables are designed to connect two similar devices, such as two computers, directly to one another [3].
options: To connect different types of networks
To increase the speed of data transmission

questions.q: Which type of cable is most commonly used in residential networking?
questions.explanation: Twisted pair cables are the most frequent choice for home and residential network setups [3].

questions.q: What is the main disadvantage of using twisted pair cables?
questions.explanation: Twisted pair cables are vulnerable to electromagnetic interference (EMI) compared to other media [3, 4].
options: They are susceptible to electromagnetic interference.

questions.q: What is the primary use of coaxial cables?
questions.explanation: Coaxial cables are primarily utilized for cable TV and high-speed internet connections [4].

questions.q: Which type of twisted pair cable is more effective at reducing electromagnetic interference?
questions.explanation: Because of its additional shielding, STP is more effective than UTP at reducing interference [4].

questions.q: Which of the following is a disadvantage of fiber optic cables?
questions.explanation: The primary drawback of fiber optic technology is its higher installation and material costs [4, 5].

questions.q: What type of cable is typically used for connecting a computer to a switch in a local area network (LAN)?
questions.explanation: Straight-through cables are used to connect different types of devices, such as a computer to a switch [5].

questions.q: Which type of cable is best suited for high-speed internet connections?
questions.explanation: Fiber optic is the superior choice for high-speed, long-distance internet connectivity [5].

questions.q: What is the main reason for twisting the pairs of wires in twisted pair cables?
questions.explanation: Twisting the wires helps cancel out and reduce electromagnetic interference [5, 6].
options: To make the cable more flexible
